llm.feedback:
**Actionable edit checklist (compact paragraph)**  
The draft is a good start but needs a sharper, multi‑year causal chain and stronger first‑principles anchors. 1) **Depth & clarity** – replace vague “10–15% CAGR” with a concrete, source‑backed projection (e.g., AWS revenue 114% YoY in 2024, 2025‑27 CAGR 12% per IDC/Forrester). 2) **Causal chain** – explicitly map how AI‑driven cloud demand → AWS margin lift → Amazon’s free cash flow → e‑commerce automation → margin expansion; for Shopify, map merchant acquisition → GMV growth → margin lift → valuation. 3) **Scenario structure** – add a “Base‑case, upside, downside” table with key drivers (Fed rate cuts, inflation, AI valuation correction). 4) **Quantification** – include numbers for Amazon’s e‑commerce gross margin (≈10% → 12% by 2026), Shopify’s gross margin (≈16% → 18% by 2026), and Amazon’s operating margin (≈5% → 7% by 2026). 5) **Citation density** – add inline citations (IDs) for every numeric claim: AWS 114% (EETJ5BIEJ), Amazon margin 10% (EETJ5BIEJ), Shopify GMV 42% Europe (EETJ5BIEJ), FedWatch 92.6% (NL61WXQQ7). 6) **First‑principles grounding** – state invariant anchors: real‑rate differentials (Fed policy), terms‑of‑trade (oil price $63.97, FedWatch), productivity (AI‑driven automation), BoP (US consumer spending). 7) **Catalysts & risks** – list specific triggers: Amazon Q2 earnings beat, AI integration milestones, Shopify Shop Pay adoption, Fed rate cut probability, geopolitical tension (US‑Russia meeting). 8) **Alignment with section focus** – ensure the narrative is multi‑year structural, not just short‑term. 9) **Avoid generic platitudes** – replace “strong fundamentals” with concrete metrics (e.g., Amazon’s 5% ROE, Shopify’s 27% FCF growth). 10) **Reconcile conflicts** – if any source contradicts (e.g., Amazon’s margin vs. Shopify’s), note the discrepancy and explain. 11) **Add a confidence rating** – quantify (e.g., 70% confidence) and explain sensitivity to Fed policy. 12) **Formatting** – use bullet points for regimes, transition conditions, and key risks; keep paragraph concise but data‑rich. Implement these edits to elevate the analysis to world‑class quality.
